meanings.definition: The quality or state of being dull or boring.
meanings.sent1: The vapidity of the lecture made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was filled with vapidity, putting everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The vapidity of the movie was so extreme that even the popcorn fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: The vapidity of the room was like a thick fog, suffocating any excitement.
meanings.sent5: The vapidity of the painting drained all color and life from the room.

meanings.sent1: The party had a sense of vapidity, with no one dancing or laughing.
meanings.sent2: The vapidity of the conversation made it hard to engage with anyone.
meanings.sent3: The vapidity of the joke fell flat, leaving everyone staring blankly.
meanings.sent4: The vapidity of the music echoed through the empty hall, devoid of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The vapidity of the performance sucked the energy out of the room, leaving it silent.

meanings.definition: A dull or tedious person or thing.
meanings.sent1: He was a walking vapidity, never showing any excitement or interest.
meanings.sent2: The vapidity of the task made it feel never-ending and monotonous.
meanings.sent3: The vapidity of the clock seemed to slow down time itself, making the day drag on.
meanings.sent4: Her vapidity was like a heavy weight, dragging down the mood of the entire group.
meanings.sent5: The vapidity of the book was like a black hole, sucking away any enjoyment.
